name: Fassi Tanjia
ingredients: 1 Kg of veal shank or lamb
A few crushed saffron threads (or 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric)
Salt (moderately, as the preserved lemon is salty)
steps: Rinse the meat and cut it into pieces (if necessary).
In the earthenware pot (tanjia) or a thick casserole, place the meat, smen, olive oil, unpeeled garlic, chopped preserved lemon, and spices (cumin, saffron/turmeric).
Mix by shaking the pot. Add the water (about 1L).
Seal the pot tightly (with parchment paper and wire).
Cook in the ashes of a traditional oven or in the oven at very low temperature (120-150Â°C) for at least 3 hours, until the meat is very tender and the sauce is reduced and creamy.
Serve hot with good homemade bread.
